home.title: Build Guitar Thinking
home.reviewDoneDesc: Great work! Learn new cards to build up tomorrow's review.

practice.title: Practice
practice.subtitle: Select a level and start practicing

mastery.title: Mastery Map
mastery.subtitle: Track your overall learning progress
mastery.weakCardsDesc: Cards with low EF scores or repeated mistakes. Master them through focused review.
mastery.emptyDesc: Start reviewing from the Home tab to see your progress here

interval.title: Interval
interval.questionSub: Tap the position on the fretboard
interval.selectPosition: Select a position on the fretboard

patternHints.P1: Same position = same note! The reference point for octave patterns.
patternHints.m2: 1 fret up on the same string = half step! The smallest interval.
patternHints.M2: 2 frets up on the same string = whole step! Most intervals in do-re-mi.
patternHints.m3: 3 frets up on the same string = minor 3rd! Core interval in minor chords.
patternHints.M3: 4 frets up on the same string = major 3rd! Bright sound in major chords.
patternHints.P4: 5 frets up on the same string = perfect 4th! Foundation of chord construction.
patternHints.TT: 6 frets up on the same string = tritone! Blues and rock tension sound.
patternHints.P5: 7 frets up on the same string = perfect 5th! Most stable and harmonious interval.
patternHints.m6: 8 frets up on the same string = minor 6th! Creates a melancholic feeling.
patternHints.M6: 9 frets up on the same string = major 6th! Bright and warm sound.
patternHints.m7: 10 frets up on the same string = minor 7th! Essential in jazz and blues.
patternHints.M7: 11 frets up on the same string = major 7th! Smooth and sophisticated sound.
patternHints.P8: 12 frets up on the same string = perfect octave! Higher version of the same note.

scale.title: Scale Pattern
scale.questionSub: Tap all notes in the scale
scale.scoreSub: Dashed circle (‚óã) = missed note ¬∑ 80%+ to pass

patternHints.major: Major scale is a bright 7-note scale. Do-Re-Mi-Fa-Sol-La-Ti-Do!
patternHints.pentatonic-major: Pentatonic major is a 5-note scale with a bright feel. Widely used in blues and rock.
patternHints.pentatonic-minor: Pentatonic minor is a 5-note scale with intense emotion. Foundation of rock solos!

ear.title: Ear Training
ear.modeDesc: One of 5 open strings (E, A, D, G, B)
ear.unlockHint: Achieve 80% in Lv.1 Note Position ‚Üí Unlock all notes mode

goals.title: Learning Goals
goals.dailyDesc: Number of cards to review per day

notifications.title: Notifications

result.perfect: Perfect! You know the fretboard well
result.great: Great job! A bit more practice and you'll master it
